column1: Grevenbroich (German pronunciation: [ˌɡʁeːvənˈbʁoːx]) is a town in the Rhein-Kreis Neuss
column3: Germany. It is situated on the river Erft
column4: approximately 15 km southwest of Neuss and 15 km southeast of Mönchengladbach. Cologne and Düsseldorf are in a 30 km reach.             It is notable for having the Frimmersdorf Power Station
column5: which was one of Europe's least carbon-efficient power stations.
